p.The Public Administration minor is relat: The Public Administration minor is related to one of the fastest growing fields in the United States today. Students studying Public Administration will gain a greater understanding of tools associated with management of public sector organizations, including fiscal management, survey research, public administration, and human resource management.

courseSection0.text:
College of Community Innovation and Education
School of Public Administration
Dr. Phillips Academic Commons (DPAC) - UCF Downtown, 446
https://ccie.ucf.edu/public-administration/public-administration/
407-823-2604
Undergraduate Programs Director: Dr. Stephanie Krick
stephanie.krick@ucf.edu
Undergraduate Programs Academic Services Coordinator: TBA

The Public Administration minor is related to one of the fastest growing fields in the United States today. Students studying Public Administration will gain a greater understanding of tools associated with management of public sector organizations, including fiscal management, survey research, public administration, and human resource management.
Minor Admission Requirements
None
Minor Requirements
None
Prerequisite Courses
None

text.College of Community Innovation and Educ: College of Community Innovation and Education

courseSection0.text1:
Complete the following: 
PAD3003 - Public Administration in American Society (3)
courseSection0.text3:
Complete at least 5 of the following: 
PAD4034 - The Administration of Public Policy (3)
PAD4104 - Administrative Theory (3)
PAD4131 - Public Sector Project Management (3)
PAD4204 - Fiscal Management (3)
PAD4414 - Human Resource Administration (3)
PAD4822 - Intergovernmental Administration (3)
PAD4720 - Research Methods in Public Administration (3)

li.Students must earn a \"C-\" (1.75) or be: Students must earn a "C-" (1.75) or better in each course in the minor.
li.Students must earn an overall GPA of 2.0: Students must earn an overall GPA of 2.0 in the minor.
li.At least 15 hours used in the minor must: At least 15 hours used in the minor must be earned at UCF within the department.
li.No credit by exam (TSD, Military credit): No credit by exam (TSD, Military credit) may be used.
li.Internship or Independent Study credit c: Internship or Independent Study credit cannot be used toward the minor without prior approval.

courseSection1.text:
Other Requirements

Students must earn a "C-" (1.75) or better in each course in the minor.
Students must earn an overall GPA of 2.0 in the minor.
At least 15 hours used in the minor must be earned at UCF within the department.
No credit by exam (TSD, Military credit) may be used.
Internship or Independent Study credit cannot be used toward the minor without prior approval.
